annotation.TEXT: Yeah, it appears that green coins are worth 2, blue coins are worth 3, and...
Hmm... So I can't break those gray ! blocks with a spin jump, and I can't grab them like ice blocks... Well, I'll worry about them later.
No, I seriously doubt I could pull that off fast enough... Oh, but wait! I almost forgot that I can wall jump! Doy!
Hmm... I don't think I can reach that 1-up with wall jumps... Oh, but did I miss something up here?
Ooh, that was neat how that path revealed itself like that. Okay, now for Level 1-2...
...[title]: [subtitle], made by [author]!
Umm... That exit didn't appear to unlock anything... Well, I guess I'm heading back in to get the normal exit now...

Hey, I know! I'll let you guys vote on which way I should go here! Should I take the blue pipe on the left, or the red pipe on the right? Vote now, and I'll take the more popular route next time! (In case of a tie, I'll make the decision randomly.)
Now, is it possible to race to the control coin block fast enough after hitting this P-switch at the start?
MOOOONNN!!! Oh, but it looks like I'll need the P-switch to get it... Nuts! I WILL come back for you later, moon!
Oh, hey! Looks like I can double-grab two springboards on my first try, too! Oh, but I forgot to get all the coins first. Ah, screw them. I'm not throwing away this double-grab now!
Happy Valentine's Day! Alright, so I've decided which hack I'm going to play next, and it is...
Ooh, now there's an ON/OFF switch, along with a blue Yoshi coin that I can safely get with a wall jump.
...Ha, ha, ha! Okay, this is the best intro ever, hands down!
Okay, now for that 1-up...
I really like that path-revealing effect. Now, let's go back to 1-2 and see if I can't get that key...
Another switch, and another Yoshi coin in a pit...
Ah, okay, and that's where that sky pipe is...
Gotta check every pipe...
Oh, an invincibility star! It's been a while since I've gotten one of those in a hack!
Now, I've seen some hacks remove the number of players choice from the title menu, but I don't think I've ever seen the actual file selection removed before...
Still, does this really affect anything? The coins all still seem to be worth 1 regardless of their color, and I'm not seeing anything else that's affected by toggling the switch...
You can wall jump in this hack?! I didn't know that! Well... This hack just got more interesting!
Hmm... Now, there's obviously a passage down below here...
Let's see if I can give you guys a better view of the P-switch by screen scrolling... Um... Okay, forget that. It appears that the L and R buttons are now non-functional for some reason.
Okay, the P-switch does nothing to the ! blocks, as I thought.
Also, I only got four Yoshi coins... I betcha the remaining one was blocked off by those ! blocks, that I still haven't found an ON/OFF switch for...
Oh, hey, it's midpoint. Also, I've noticed that the coins are at different points in their spinning animation, if you know what I mean. They're not all spinning in unison, so to speak.
It's another red level, and I bet the secret exit will actually take me somewhere this time!
Oh, man. Dotted blue switch blocks down there. Please don't tell me the last Yoshi coin is down there!

Okay, I would've been shocked if he managed to triple-grab the springboards like that! I think there actually is a way to multi-grab more than two springboards, but it requires a different setup than this.
Whoa, hello! Good thing I got the Yoshi coin first!
Yeah, there's a P-switch, behind more of those ! blocks... Argh! Those ! blocks are really starting to annoy me! Where's that ON/OFF switch that I'm assuming I need to find?
Oh, and there's a P-switch to my upper-left! I'm thinking maybe that ? block I couldn't reach before might be a vine, so I've just got to figure out how to get those ! blocks out of the way.
Yeah, that worked perfectly! Now I can get the secret exit! But then, what was the control coin for? Maybe it was just there to give you up to 63 coins and that's it?

The wall jump doesn't give you a huge boost though, and you can't bounce off of the same side twice in a row (you'd have to alternate between walls on both sides of you). Still, this could be very cool.
Oh, that's neat. This obviously reminds me of one of the Hacks 101 tips involving ON/OFF color indicators.
Doesn't look like there's anything else up there.
Aw, but there weren't enough enemies to get a 1-up combo...
Gotta check every pipe... Wait, I already checked these, right?

Huh? Where'd that additional cloud come from? ...Oh! Wasn't there a Yoshi coin there before? Ah, that was very clever of you! Except, it was kind of unnecessary here, since I was going to come back with springboard(s) anyway.
A goal? This must be the secret exit! I wonder if the fact that the goal posts are red is meant to indicate that.
Heck, yeah. Trashing Ice blocks.
Oh, cool. There's more ice blocks over here, so I can still hit every block.
Okay, now very carefully get these red coins...
Nuts. It doesn't look like I can reach the P-switch that way. Unless, maybe I...
That was just me playing stupidly again, but fortunately, once again, I can replace my lost power up right away.
Heck, yeah. Springboard juggling.
Yeah, now I don't have enough ice blocks to hit every ? block here. D'oh!
Okay, seriously. You can stop accidentally double-grabbing now! Did this hack make double-grabbing easier or something?
Those are neat-looking ? blocks.

Well, I obviously missed something to the left. I'll worry about it later. Also, I wonder how you're meant to get out of this pit if you destroyed all the turn blocks and didn't have a springboard. Are you expected to make a six-tile high jump in that case?
And now we've got color gradients. (This reminds me of another Hacks 101 tip.)
And, there's the goal... Accompanied by random bullets for some reason. Hey, maybe I can use them...
Well, seeing how the screen scrolling stops here, I guess I'll go down this pipe...
Ooh, a vine. Oh, there's the last Yoshi coin!
Yeah, that path revealing just looks neat. Ooh, a ? level... Well, it's already been over 12 minutes... But okay, I guess I could take a look at this level now!
Oh, alright! It only took a few quick tries to get it to work again! I guess I'm still lucky with that!
D'oh! Stupid piranha plant! You ruined my lucky double-grab! Now it'll probably take me forever to get the double-grab to work again!
Hmm... But, which way should I go now? I'm not sure...
Okay, I think I can get a replacement flower here...
Ooh, those are interesting level dots. Now, this is a red level, so there should be two exits for me to find here...
Yeah, that looked like a good use for it, so I could reach the key, but... Is there a P-switch handy?
Oh, hey, it's the title demo level. Now, I'm not going to take a whole minute to get through this room like the demo did. Oh, but I wonder... Are the different-colored coins worth more?
Also, you apparently can't wall jump while carrying something. Good to know.
More of those gray ! blocks. Oh, I never did find an ON/OFF block in the last level. I'll probably search that level again later. Huh? What the?
Oh, of course you can double-grab springboards on your first try. Well, let's watch the rest of this demo here...
Ah, a Yoshi coin. But, can I go even further with wall jumps?
Yeah, I'm thinking that ? block down there has gotta be a vine, which is how you'd reach the P-switch, but maybe I could pull off a midair springboard jump to reach it?

Okay, seriously, YouTube, this very song has played in so many of my other videos, so why are you giving me "Matched third party content" notices about it now? (It also did this for this same song on my 7th Greenman's Island of Insanity video.)
Bullet Bill: "Hah! Take that, Mario!" Nuts, but that's okay, because I can replace my lost power up right away.
Whoa, a control coin? Umm... Let me quickly guide it somewhere potentially useful!
Okay, you can't wall jump while spinning. Good thing I thought to check that now so I don't get screwed over by that later.
Man, this demo's been going on for a while now...
Hah! Take that, Bullet Bill!
Well, there's the keyhole, so at least now I know where that is.
That blue coin down there... Is it a hint at a secret? I don't know. Maybe I'll check back later.
Ooh, what's that I just saw up there? Well, I have a springboard, so I'm going to check it out!

Actually, this hack was made by TRS, and can be found on SMW Central. It's also a "Demo 2", which I guess means it's the second demo or something... Oh, and Zeldara109 was the one who suggested this hack to me.
Umm... Maybe I shouldn't have done that...
Gimme that blue coin!
...red coins are worth 5. That means this room contained a total of 93 coins. That's almost a whole extra life by itself.
To be continued...
There's the fourth Yoshi coin. I wonder if the fifth one will be impossible for me to reach right now...
Yep, and now to unlock the secret exit.
Okay, finally. Now, let's press Start...
Well, I got a 40 that way...
Ah, I saw that 1-up up there! But, how do you reach it?
Vines! But, I totally see stuff below!
Oh, screw this. I could almost definitely do it with tool-assistance, but I don't feel like wasting any more time trying to do it normally. Oh, but I just saw something else?
Wow, no file selection screen?
BARF! Gotta stop being stupid...
Oh, but I think I know how I can get that 1-up. I just need to bring a springboard from that bonus room.
Okay, these blocks can't be removed by fireballs. I'm guessing I'll need to find an ON/OFF switch somewhere.
Outta my way, everything!
Huh, gray ! blocks, and they're kind of in the way of me hitting that ? block. So, how can I get rid of them? Hmm...
Ooh, gotta get every Yoshi coin!
Yes, and I get rewarded with a 1-up!
And there's Yoshi coin number four already.
